Type: Upper-body aerobic (arm-crank ergometer, wheelchair-propulsion intervals, seated rowing)
RestPeriod: Brief 1–2-min breaks every 5–10 min; avoid >24 h between sessions
Progression: Add 5 min to each session every 2 weeks if shoulders are pain-free
Supervision: Initial assessment with a wheelchair-trained physiotherapist; monitor skin & shoulder strain

Type: Progressive resistance training (shoulders, chest, back, arms, core)
Progression: Increase resistance 5–10 % when 12 reps feel easy and pain-free
Supervision: Start with a physiotherapist to prevent over-use injury and ensure posture

Type: Flexibility & ROM (neck, shoulders, trunk, hip flexors)
Pressure-relief push-ups / leans every 15–30 min for 30–90 s
Progression: Extend stretch holds to 30 s; add thoracic rotations once comfortable
Supervision: Follow individual plan; maintain safe posture during pressure relief
